item.title: Bulletin updated at 18:02 HKT 12/06/2023
item.description:
At 6 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 31 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 72 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 0.8
Intensity of UV radiation : low

The area of low pressure now over the northern part of the South China Sea is moving eastwards across the region slowly and remained quite weak. It will continue to remain a relatively weak system with high winds confined to its southern part. The area of low pressure will skirt about 200 kilometres to the southeast of the Pearl River Estuary tonight to tomorrow (13 June) morning. The Observatory will continue to closely monitor its development and movement. Under the influence of the area of low pressure and its associated trough of low pressure, there will be heavy showers over the northern part of the South China Sea. However, these low pressure systems will maintain a distance from the coast of Guangdong. The weather will be persistently very hot with a few showers over the region tomorrow. Members of the public please continue to pay attention to the latest weather information.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The public should beware of heat stroke and drink more water.
